tip: This swordsman is no match for you!
Your available units are displayed at the bottom of the screen.
Click on your unit, then click anywhere on the left side of the battlefield to place them.
When you are ready to battle, click start in the upper right corner.
Cavalry move much faster than a swordsman, but deal less damage.
You can snap units to a grid using "shift", and control time using "space", "+", and "-".
The Cavalry's speed gives them the edge in battle against archers.
Wizards shoot powerful fireballs that explode, damaging all nearby units. Spreading out your army can distract your foes.
Each time you finish a level, you swap the army you used for the army you beat!
The placement of your units is critical to an efficient victory.
Any units you save can be used in future levels!
Take the cavalry out before reinforcements arrive!
Should you divide to conquer?
Duelists deal very high damage, but are fragile and are vulnerable to archers.
When using duelists, try to keep them behind other units.
You can also revisit previous levels to improve your solutions.
When you revisit a level, you can remove units from your previous solution and add something different.
By doing this, you can free up units for future levels.
This is great to try whenever you're stuck on a level!
Defenders are weak but take less damage due to their armor, and also move slowly.
Rangers are slow but deal high damage.
Pikemen are like swordsmen with extra reach at the cost of slower movement.
Healers will restore the health of their damaged allies.
Paladins have  high health and they can heal themselves,
but they have low damage and are overwhelmed by groups.
Commanders are weak on their own, but they increase the damage of their allies.
If you need to, you can also revisit previous levels to improve your solutions.
Hint: Try taking them out one at a time.
Defenders and pikemen are a powerful pairing.
Gold Knights damage all enemy units around them and heal a little with every hit.
This makes them excellent against groups of melee units, but vulnerable to ranged or strong opponents.
Cavalry's here!
Remember that you can also revisit previous levels to improve your solutions.
It would be great to have a duelist or two to overwhelm the enemy's healing.
Stronger united!
Note that the commander aura does not stack.
Remember that gold knights deal damage to all enemy units around them and heal a little with every hit.
The Black Knight scares away his foes with his cruel attacks.

Wizards are unreliable allies.
Zombies coming soon!
Longbowmen have very long range and powerful arrows.
Longbowmen work great with units to protect them from fast units
Guardian angels provide cheap and consistent healing to a single unit.
Soliders are well rounded units with ranged attacks, melee attacks, and armor.
Black knights thrive on chaos.
Catapults hurl projectiles that deal extremely high damage to all units in an area.
Catapults are immobile, and can't hit targets which are too close.
Unlike most ranged units, soldiers are resistant to flanking.
